trans-unit.source: Stop changing the size of a pool
trans-unit.target: Stop changing the size of a pool

trans-unit.source: Stops an ongoing resize operation on the pool.
trans-unit.target: Stops an ongoing resize operation on the pool.

trans-unit.source: Note that this does not restore the pool to its previous state before the resize operation.
trans-unit.target: Note that this does not restore the pool to its previous state before the resize operation.

trans-unit.source: It will only stop the on-going resize transaction on the pool, and the pool will maintain its current state.
trans-unit.target: It will only stop the on-going resize transaction on the pool, and the pool will maintain its current state.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="0e07b9cb-8fdf-4ff7-b707-e964200df0f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Common parameters and headers</link> for headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to pools.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="0e07b9cb-8fdf-4ff7-b707-e964200df0f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Common parameters and headers</link> for headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to pools.

trans-unit.source: Method
trans-unit.target: Method

trans-unit.source: Request URI
trans-unit.target: Request URI

trans-unit.source: POST
trans-unit.target: POST

trans-unit.source: Replace {pool-id} with the id of the pool who resize operation you want to stop.
trans-unit.target: Replace {pool-id} with the id of the pool who resize operation you want to stop.

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: Status code: 202.
trans-unit.target: Status code: 202.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="e9da2d54-053a-4392-a5ba-26229c7cc9a5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="e9da2d54-053a-4392-a5ba-26229c7cc9a5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: A Stop Pool Resize operation stops the ongoing resize operation on the pool.
trans-unit.target: A Stop Pool Resize operation stops the ongoing resize operation on the pool.

trans-unit.source: The pool size will stabilize at the number of nodes it is at when the stop operation is done.
trans-unit.target: The pool size will stabilize at the number of nodes it is at when the stop operation is done.

trans-unit.source: During the stop operation, the pool allocation state changes first to stopping and then to steady.
trans-unit.target: During the stop operation, the pool allocation state changes first to stopping and then to steady.

trans-unit.source: A resize operation need not be an explicit Resize Pool request; this API can also be used to halt the initial sizing of the pool when it is created.
trans-unit.target: A resize operation need not be an explicit Resize Pool request; this API can also be used to halt the initial sizing of the pool when it is created.

trans-unit.source: If you call Stop Resize Pool on a pool which is not in the resizing state, the request fails with HTTP status code 409 (Conflict).
trans-unit.target: If you call Stop Resize Pool on a pool which is not in the resizing state, the request fails with HTTP status code 409 (Conflict).

trans-unit.source: Example
trans-unit.target: Example

trans-unit.source: At 1:00 pm, a user sends a request to create a pool of 100 compute nodes.
trans-unit.target: At 1:00 pm, a user sends a request to create a pool of 100 compute nodes.

trans-unit.source: The Batch service creates the pool, marks the pool allocation state as resizing, and starts assigning nodes to the pool.
trans-unit.target: The Batch service creates the pool, marks the pool allocation state as resizing, and starts assigning nodes to the pool.

trans-unit.source: At 1:05 pm, the Batch service has allocated 25 nodes to the pool.
trans-unit.target: At 1:05 pm, the Batch service has allocated 25 nodes to the pool.

trans-unit.source: The pool is still resizing, as Batch has not yet acquired all 100 requested nodes, and currentDedicated is 25.
trans-unit.target: The pool is still resizing, as Batch has not yet acquired all 100 requested nodes, and currentDedicated is 25.

trans-unit.source: At this point, the user stops the pool resize operation with the Stop Resize Pool API.
trans-unit.target: At this point, the user stops the pool resize operation with the Stop Resize Pool API.

trans-unit.source: When the Batch service receives this request, it stops attempting to acquire more nodes for the pool, updates the pool’s resizeError to indicate that the user cancelled resizing, and changed the the pool’s allocation state to steady.
trans-unit.target: When the Batch service receives this request, it stops attempting to acquire more nodes for the pool, updates the pool’s resizeError to indicate that the user cancelled resizing, and changed the the pool’s allocation state to steady.

trans-unit.source: The pool’s currentDedicated remains at 25, and targetDedicated remains at 100.
trans-unit.target: The pool’s currentDedicated remains at 25, and targetDedicated remains at 100.
